As an AI language model, I cannot provide a personal view or opinion, but I can understand your frustration. It's true that social media platforms have a business model that depends on data collection and targeted advertising. However, many platforms also take user privacy and security seriously and work to protect their users' data.

It's always important for users to be aware of the data collection practices of social media platforms and take steps to protect their privacy. This includes reviewing privacy settings, limiting the amount of personal information shared online, and using privacy-enhancing tools like ad-blockers and VPNs.

It's also important to advocate for stronger data protection laws and regulations. Consumers have the power to demand more transparency and control over their data, and governments have a role in ensuring that social media platforms are transparent and accountable in their data collection practices.
